## Introduction 

Why do we use Git?

- Git serves as a lab notebook for the digital world: a version control system used to keep track of changes to files, and to collaborate with others 
- Provides snapshots of project, to provide a full record of the project's history 
- Makes it easy to reproduce and roll back to past versions 
- Useful for collaborative sharing 
- Keeps work and software organized and available
